intro: Chirita angusta, commonly known as narrowleaf chirita, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in some regions.
